meanings.definition: To result or happen as a consequence.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain may eventuate in flooding of the streets.
meanings.sent2: The meeting may eventuate in a decision being made.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected snowstorm eventuated in a snowball fight.
meanings.sent4: The long hours of practice eventuated in a flawless performance.
meanings.sent5: The seeds planted in spring eventuated into a beautiful garden by summer.

meanings.definition: To come about or occur as a result.
meanings.sent1: The delay in the flight eventuated due to bad weather.
meanings.sent2: The hard work will eventuate in success eventually.
meanings.sent3: The chef's experiment eventuated in a delicious new dish.
meanings.sent4: The peaceful protest eventuated in positive changes in the community.
meanings.sent5: The friendship eventuated from a chance encounter at the park.
